about.description:
Chronic is halfway between a simple timer and a profiler. Add
decorators or wrap code in with statements to get the execution time.
Chronic keeps track of the call hierarchy to tell you what timed
blocks executed within other timed blocks. Attach an event listener
to log your timings however you want.

If you are looking for the command line tool chronic which silences
stdout and stderr unless a command fails, that is avilable as part of
the moreutils conda-forge package.

Chronic is halfway between a simple timer and a profiler. Add
decorators or wrap code in with statements to get the execution time.
Chronic keeps track of the call hierarchy to tell you what timed
blocks executed within other timed blocks. Attach an event listener
to log your timings however you want.

If you are looking for the command line tool chronic which silences
stdout and stderr unless a command fails, that is avilable as part of
the moreutils conda-forge package.

name: chronic
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "chronic" %}
{% set version = "0.3.4" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/chronic-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 99692d41752250fb28b4c9b2db1823ff89345c917dccb9f4d643dfb12d31d287
  patches:
    - time.patch

build:
  number: 2
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - pip
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }}

test:
  imports:
    - signals
  commands:
    - pip check
  requires:
    - pip
    - python {{ python_min }}

about:
  home: http://github.com/davidcrawford/chronic
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: 'Half profiler, half timer, 100% fun.'
  description: |
    Chronic is halfway between a simple timer and a profiler. Add 
    decorators or wrap code in with statements to get the execution time. 
    Chronic keeps track of the call hierarchy to tell you what timed 
    blocks executed within other timed blocks. Attach an event listener 
    to log your timings however you want.

    If you are looking for the command line tool chronic which silences
    stdout and stderr unless a command fails, that is avilable as part of
    the moreutils conda-forge package.
  doc_url: http://github.com/davidcrawford/chronic
  dev_url: http://github.com/davidcrawford/chronic

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - jan-janssen
